svg.text: title: "January 4, 2019" date: "2019-01-04"
News and Links
Layer 1
* [eth1] Quick summary of Constantinople hard fork
[eth1] Quick summary of Constantinople hard fork
* [maybe eth1, eth2] ELI5 storage rent
[maybe eth1, eth2] ELI5 storage rent
* [eth2] What’s New in Eth2 from Ben Edgington

* Latest Eth2 implementers call . Agenda to help follow along (plus brief notes in
What’s New in eth2 above)
Latest Eth2 implementers call . Agenda to help follow along (plus brief notes in What’s
New in eth2 above)
* [eth2] An updated Beacon chain mini-spec

included in chain

* [eth2[ Justin Drake: Eth2 consensus objects natively compatible with multiple hash
functions

* [eth2] How Vitalik thinks about incentives for stakers to stay online

Layer 2
* Cryptoplayer.one - rock-paper-scissors (with a StarWars flavor) on Raiden, acted out
by robots you can watch on Youtube. Try it out - it helps test Raiden.
Cryptoplayer.one - rock-paper-scissors (with a StarWars flavor) on Raiden, acted out by
robots you can watch on Youtube. Try it out - it helps test Raiden.
* An overview of state channels projects
An overview of state channels projects
* Connext opensourced their generalized custodial hub . You can check out their hub ,
client , and contract code. Non-custodial hub coming in the next month.
Connext opensourced their generalized custodial hub . You can check out their hub ,
Stuff for developers
* Austin Griffith: Burner Wallet v2.2 , burner-to-burner encrypted messaging with Eth
keys. Also solid ELI5 of Burner Wallet
Austin Griffith: Burner Wallet v2.2 , burner-to-burner encrypted messaging with Eth
* OpenZeppelin v2.1
OpenZeppelin v2.1
* Truffle v5.0.1
Truffle v5.0.1
* Paul Berg’s how to write upgradeable code with Truffle5 and ZeppelinOS2
Paul Berg’s how to write upgradeable code with Truffle5 and ZeppelinOS2
* Intro to Mythril Classic and symbolic execution
Intro to Mythril Classic and symbolic execution
* ConsenSys Diligence’s registry of code weakness and test cases

* SmartCheck security tool adds Vyper
SmartCheck security tool adds Vyper
* Minimal Solidity testing with Ganache and Jest

* Yondon Fu: How not to use ECDSA
Yondon Fu: How not to use ECDSA
* “stack too deep” error in Solidity
“stack too deep” error in Solidity
* Jez San on thinking about GDPR and blockchain

* Video example of queries to GraphQL api with 3box.js
Video example of queries to GraphQL api with 3box.js

Monitoring events with Kauri’s Eventeum
* ConsenSysDesign’s rimble v0.2 adaptable components and design standards
ConsenSysDesign’s rimble v0.2 adaptable components and design standards
* Gitcoin Grants an easy way to give recurring contributions to your favorite OSS
projects and maintainers. Ben Edgington’s UX report
Gitcoin Grants an easy way to give recurring contributions to your favorite OSS
Ecosystem
* In case you haven’t noticed on Twitter, all the cool kids are getting an Eth dappnode
from Ava.do [I don’t have one, but I want to be cool, so I’m probably going to get one]
In case you haven’t noticed on Twitter, all the cool kids are getting an Eth dappnode
* Bernhard Mueller’s hilarious tweetstorm satire of a maxi tweetstorm
Bernhard Mueller’s hilarious tweetstorm satire of a maxi tweetstorm
* EthHub launches . Great documentation and FAQs for devs/users
EthHub launches . Great documentation and FAQs for devs/users
* A note about Blockchains LLC from founder Jeffrey Berns
A note about Blockchains LLC from founder Jeffrey Berns
* imToken at 7.5m accumulated installed devices, 30% iOS, 70% Android
imToken at 7.5m accumulated installed devices, 30% iOS, 70% Android
* To every Bitcoin maximalist who says you can’t run a full node, Afri very strongly
disagrees .
To every Bitcoin maximalist who says you can’t run a full node, Afri very strongly
* More Afri: on Jan 3, only 10.2% of nodes were Constantinople-ready . Update your
clients!
More Afri: on Jan 3, only 10.2% of nodes were Constantinople-ready . Update your
* ConsenSys and AMD’s W3BCLOUD collaboration “to develop optimized solutions powered by
AMD hardware” for enterprise and dapps (link opens PDF)
ConsenSys and AMD’s W3BCLOUD collaboration “to develop optimized solutions powered by
Enterprise
* John Wolpert on lessons learned in blockchain consulting
John Wolpert on lessons learned in blockchain consulting
* Busting the myth of private blockchains
Busting the myth of private blockchains
* Kaleido launches Marketplace for “blockchain at consortia scale”
Kaleido launches Marketplace for “blockchain at consortia scale”
Governance and Standards
* Core devs call . Agenda . Summary per Hudson, “Constantinople is on track. We are
already starting to develop timelines for Istanbul. ProgPoW is going to happen barring
any major issues.”
Core devs call . Agenda . Summary per Hudson, “Constantinople is on track. We are
* Lane Rettig on transparency and the Devcon meetings on the PoW chain that caused a
ruckus
Lane Rettig on transparency and the Devcon meetings on the PoW chain that caused a
Application layer (I decided no 2018 reviews; those could have been the whole
newsletter)
* Many Augur markets ended on Dec 31, so there is a record 140 disputes in this week’s
round. Also prediction markets to facilitate cross-chain swaps ?
Many Augur markets ended on Dec 31, so there is a record 140 disputes in this week’s
* Grid+ rolling out electricity to more in next couple months; had Samsung stop
manufacturing a component of Lattice agent, so had to replace; still on track for Q2
Grid+ rolling out electricity to more in next couple months; had Samsung stop
* Air quality data streams from 10,210 locations in 68 countries on Streamr
Air quality data streams from 10,210 locations in 68 countries on Streamr
* BloqPress - a web3 CMS
BloqPress - a web3 CMS
* Pando - decentralized VCS enabling contribution tracking, via the Aragon client
Pando - decentralized VCS enabling contribution tracking, via the Aragon client
* DX.exchange - buy tokens representing Tesla, Apple and 8 more Nasdaq stocks where the
stock is held in custody. Per Bloomberg , this goes live next week. To me, the
interesting bit is that now those stacks can trade 24/7
DX.exchange - buy tokens representing Tesla, Apple and 8 more Nasdaq stocks where the
Interviews, Podcasts, Videos, Talks
* Starkware’s Eli Ben-Sasson and Uri Kolodny on Into the Ether
Starkware’s Eli Ben-Sasson and Uri Kolodny on Into the Ether
* Vitalik Buterin with Kartik Talwar at ETHSingapore
Vitalik Buterin with Kartik Talwar at ETHSingapore
* Jutta Steiner on ZeroKnowledge
Jutta Steiner on ZeroKnowledge
Tokens / Business / Regulation
* Livepeer network economics update . LPT continues to be an interesting experiment
(and you probably have some from the MerkleMine airdrop)
Livepeer network economics update . LPT continues to be an interesting experiment (and
you probably have some from the MerkleMine airdrop)
* Cameroon separatists launch their own currency on Ethereum. Reading the article
doesn’t give me great hope for its legitimacy, but it’s an interesting idea.
Cameroon separatists launch their own currency on Ethereum. Reading the article doesn’t
give me great hope for its legitimacy, but it’s an interesting idea.
* Interesting funding model from Mintable: selling NFTs that let you use their app for
free for life.
Interesting funding model from Mintable: selling NFTs that let you use their app for
* Santiment built an Ethereum token market cap
Santiment built an Ethereum token market cap
General
* Elegy for a cypherpunk . Remembering Tim May. Nice work about the values from which
our space springs.
Elegy for a cypherpunk . Remembering Tim May. Nice work about the values from which our
space springs.
* How much each year Ethereum is mentioned in Google Scholar articles
How much each year Ethereum is mentioned in Google Scholar articles
* IEEE: Ethereum plans to cut energy consumption by 99%
IEEE: Ethereum plans to cut energy consumption by 99%
* Proof of existence timestamp chain on Substrate
Proof of existence timestamp chain on Substrate
* Chris Dixon: blockchains can wrest internet control from corporations
Chris Dixon: blockchains can wrest internet control from corporations
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new in bold ):
* Jan 10 - Mobi Grand Challenge hackathon ends
Jan 10 - Mobi Grand Challenge hackathon ends
* Jan 10-Feb7 - 0x and Coinlist virtual hackathon
Jan 10-Feb7 - 0x and Coinlist virtual hackathon
* Jan ~16 - Constantinople hard fork at block 7080000
Jan ~16 - Constantinople hard fork at block 7080000
* Jan 24 - Aragon vote , including on funding original AragonOne team
Jan 24 - Aragon vote , including on funding original AragonOne team
* Jan 29-30 - AraCon (Berlin)
Jan 29-30 - AraCon (Berlin)
* Jan 31 - GörliCon (Berlin)
Jan 31 - GörliCon (Berlin)
* Feb 7-8 - Melonport’s M1 conf (Zug)
Feb 7-8 - Melonport’s M1 conf (Zug)
* Feb 15-17 - ETHDenver hackathon (ETHGlobal)
Feb 15-17 - ETHDenver hackathon (ETHGlobal)
* Feb 23-25 - EthAustin (EthUniversal)
Feb 23-25 - EthAustin (EthUniversal)
* Mar 4 - Ethereum Magicians (Paris)
Mar 4 - Ethereum Magicians (Paris)
* Mar 5-7 - EthCC (Paris)
Mar 5-7 - EthCC (Paris)
* Mar 8-10 - ETHParis (ETHGlobal)
Mar 8-10 - ETHParis (ETHGlobal)
* Mar 27 - Infura end of legacy key support (Jan 23 begins Project ID prioritization)
Mar 27 - Infura end of legacy key support (Jan 23 begins Project ID prioritization)
* April 8-14 - Edcon hackathon and conference (Sydney)
April 8-14 - Edcon hackathon and conference (Sydney)
* Apr 19-21 - ETHCapetown (ETHGlobal)
Apr 19-21 - ETHCapetown (ETHGlobal)
* May 10-11 - Ethereal (NYC)
May 10-11 - Ethereal (NYC)
If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys
This newsletter is made possible by ConsenSys .
I own Week In Ethereum. Editorial control has always been 100% me.
If you’re unhappy with editorial decisions or anything that I have written in this
issue, feel free to tweet at me .
Housekeeping
Follow me on Twitter, because most of what is linked gets tweeted first: @evan_van_ness
If you’re wondering “ why didn’t my post make it into Week in Ethereum ?”
Week in Ethereum News
